properties.name: Bish World Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove1475 Lower Water StreetStart off with the Nova Scotia smoked salmon with asparagus and arugula, continue with either the flash seared tuna with lemongrass red curry butter sauce and basmati rice or grilled salmon with twice fried sweet potatoes and wasabi aioli. Finish your night with either the torched banana Boston cream pie or the chocolate pound cake and coconut ice cream sandwich.

properties.name: Carnegie Hall
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveCarnegie HallIf you have a chance to go - GO! Even if you don\'t care for what you\'ve gone to see the architecture and acoustics are phenomenal.

properties.name: Central Park, New York
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveWho goes to New York City and doesn\'t make time for this?

properties.name: Doubletree Metropolitan Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove 569 Lexington Ave, New York, NYA great place to stay if you want to be in the middle of everything.

properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Shoutloveempire state buildingNo trip to New York City is complete without a trip to the Empire State Building.

properties.name: Fairmont Hotel Vancouver
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove 900 West Georgia Street, Vancouver, CanadaThis is where I stayed. It\'s a very comfortable, posh hotel in the center of everything.

properties.name: Gastown
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveWater Street, Vancouver, BCGastown is a quaint, beautiful area of Vancouver.

properties.name: Greenwich Village
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveThis was on my list of must-see places in New York City when I went.

properties.name: Kate's Paperie
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove561 Broadway, New York, NY 10012Rediscover your love of pen and paper.

properties.name: Lupo Caffe
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveI am convinced this place has the best paninis in Vancouver.

properties.name: McKelvie's
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove1680 Lower Water St.Start with the red curry mussels or Willie Krauch smoked salmon or Thai vegetable spring rolls. Continue with pan seared halibut or blackened salmon.

properties.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove 5th Avenue, Manhattan, New YorkI didn\'t make it here but I hear it\'s amazing.

properties.name: Opa Greek Taverna
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove1565 Argyle StreetGo for the Baked Feta for starters. Continue with the Seared Sesame Salmon and wrap it up with the chocolate baklava.

properties.name: Ryan Duffy's
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove5640 Spring Garden RoadI recommend going for brunch and getting the omelet with brie, chicken and asparagus.

properties.name: Serendipity 3
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove225 E 60th St, New York, NYUnfortunately after waiting a half hour to get in the line was still quite long so we decided to leave, but I hear it\'s AMAZING.

properties.name: Strand Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove828 Broadway, New York, NYIts claim to fame is \'18 Miles of Books\' a must for the bibliophile in your life.

properties.name: Times Square
properties.description: Posted by ShoutloveA must-see if in New York City. It is so alive and so busy, it\'s amazing.

properties.name: Urban Outfitters
properties.description: Posted by Shoutlove2081 Broadway, New York, NYMy all-time favourite clothes and accessories store in NYC.
